name: Erase Screen
description:
Downloadable game for Windows, MacOs and Linux.

 

In a dystopian world, TV, Internet and digital images control everything. The whole population is trapped in a huge metal tower with hundreds of screens. Try to escape the Screen Tower ! 


In 1956, in his paper The Magical Number Seven, Plus or Minus Two, George Armitage Miller, American psychologist, observed the presence of an average limit of seven for human short-term memory capacity.

In a dystopian world, TV, Internet and digital images control everything. People are forced to look all the images and are constantly connected. The whole population is trapped in a huge metal tower with hundreds of screens. They lose their short-term memory capacity…

You are imprisoned on the top floor of the tower. Try to escape the Screen Tower just in 7 moves !

Try to escape the Screen Tower by jumping on the platforms. At the beginning of each level, you must choose the possible actions for the character by dragging and dropping them in the memory bar. Be careful, if you pass in front of some screens, the character loses capacity. Good luck !

Press R to reset level and press E to use specials actions (hacking, push button, pull…).

- Immersive game
- 5 levels with diabolic screens 
- Thousand possibilities but only one way to escape !
- Insane soundtrack
- Keep your human short-term memory capacity

This game has been made for the #GameJamARTE by :

Claudia Molinari (Mentor)

Camille Demouzon (graphist)
Harmonie Games (graphist/game design)

Enki Londe (programmer)
Sébastien Berthoud (scenarist/level design).
